taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section hispidi;species compos;

treatment.description: Forming extensive carpets; primocanes glandless, with scattered divergent bristles; primocane-leaves sublustrous, dark green, 3 (sometimes 5)-foliolate, subcoriaceous, their petioles remotely bristly; their terminal leaflets rhombic-ovate to -obovate, acute, 4-7 cm. long, serrate or serrate-dentate; floricane-leaflets acute; small raceme corymbiform, the pilose pedicels mostly 8-12 mm, long.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Open ground, n. Mich. Fr. late Aug.
